title: I changed my email ages ago, But when i try to log in with linux or firefox portable it doesn't work
content:
I changed my email address in firefox settings a while ago, had no problems since. But recently wanted to use firefox portable. What happens is, i log in with my (new) email, I get sent an authentication code to the new email, i type it in, then it tries to login with my old email and obviously fails (Incorrect password)

If i try it too many times my account locks, don't know what to do
creator: leah2185155

title: Access bookmarks from old computer
content:
My other computer was recently stolen and when I logged into Firefox on my new one, none of the bookmarks were there. I can see my old laptop under connected services in "Firefox accounts" and wonder if there's a way to access them from there somehow.

Note: I double checked which profile I was logged into (suggestion from forum) and switched to the other one, but it shows the same thing. I also tried to "sync" as soon as I logged in on the new computer, but none of my old bookmarks show up after doing this either.

Any help is greatly appreciated!
creator: fmgonzal08

title: whatsweb não conecta
content: ao acessar o endereço https://web.whatsapp.com/ pelo Firefox, e escanear o código pelo celular, a página do whats não abre, o Firefox fica se atualizando interminavelmente e não abre o whats web, em outros navegadores consigo conectar normalmente pelo whats web. Mas não quero usar outros navegadores, gosto do Firefox. :) Já fiz a restauração, já desinstalei, instalei e não consigo. Outros sites navegam normalmente

title: saving tabs on startup
content:
Hi,

My tabs from my previous session aren't being saved on start up even though I have that option selected in my preferences. Often, it will bring up four tabs I had from six years ago. Today, it brought up tabs from a session I had last week. I have tried going to history, but there is no 'restore session or tabs' option; just the option to choose from recently closed tabs.

Thanks,

title: Remembered passwords not showing
content:
I have Firefox browser 97.0 (64-bit) installed. It remembers 30-40 passwords so I always log in with ease, but recently when I go to security tab and click to show saved logins, only 3 would show. All others are remembered and log in fine, but I cannot show them, which only happened recently, so it happened after a newer version was installed, I assume.

How can I show all remembered passwords? Thank you.

title: Click Address Bar not showing top sites
content: Previously I was able to click my address bar and it would show a drop down with various sites that I frequently visited. I think it updated and I can no longer do this, is it possible to revert back to this option?

title: Firefox addon Video Download helper no longer works on Macintosh
content: I have been using the add on Video Downloadhelper with Firefox browser for a couple of years now, and all of a sudden, out of nowhere it no longer will work, claiming I need to install a thing called a companion app. (attached).... https://user-media-prod-cdn.itsre-sumo.mozilla.net/uploads/images/2022-02-23-22-31-04-0f2318.png This was never a problem until recently the last week or so, because it would ask whether I wanted to use the companion app. or browser to download, now it will only use the companion app. to download videos. This is only a problem because Macintosh, and Apple are such kill joys when it comes to security that nothing works on them, and it will not install the companion app, because it cannot scan it for viruses or some such nonsense. (attached) https://user-media-prod-cdn.itsre-sumo.mozilla.net/uploads/images/2022-02-23-22-31-14-480a6b.png I swear to god, I wish to the lord above that I had NEVER switched over to an Apple computer from my Windows machines, but I thought it was supposed to be a better device, not realizing that it is secure to the point where almost NOTHING can be installed on it. I just do not get how this makes for a better computer experience at all. It all seems like overkill to me, and ridiculous when you cannot even use addons for a browser anymore without the Apple Super Geeks deciding not to allow it for whatever ignorant reason, but making a computer that cannot use any software you didn't purchase from Apple does not improve the experience at all JERKS. It would be different if Apple ever made in applications that were useful / helpful, but they don't and anything they do put out that is worth a spit costs literally THOUSANDS of Dollars because they are so full of themselves at that company that they believe they are the only ones who know how computers should work, or be used. Can someone please explain to me how to make this addon work again, even on a piece of garbage Macintrash device?? Thanks in advance!!
creator: zlloyd2

title: cannot access google drive
content: Whenever I try to access a Google doc on Google drive, I get the message, "We detected malware on this device." I ran Malwarebytes on my Mac which found nothing. This is now happening on two different computers in two different locations more than 1,000 miles apart. I am able to access Google docs and Drive in Google Chrome browser but not in Firefox or Safari. The error message in Safari says nothing about a virus, only "We noticed unusual activity in your Google Account. To keep your account safe, you were signed out." Thanks

content:

title: saving passwords
content:
On a secure web site, whenever I open the page a drop down menu appears asking me if I want to save the log in information or not save it. I mistakenly clicked on save. I don't want to automatically open the web site with a click of the mouse. I want to enter my account information and enter my password each time. I don't know how to reverse my mistake and have the requirement to log in each time. (Out of curiosity, just where is the password data saved?)

Additionally. how can I avoid having that nuisance window from popping open each time I want to log in? It is an extra step I don't need to make to keep answering no every time I access the site.
